claim: Adelanto is the only city with a K–8 magnet school offering Multiple Provision Types, and it has exactly one such school.
extra_info: Kindergarten to 8th grade refers to K-8; 'Offers a magnet program' means Magnet = 1; Multiple Provision Types refers to `NSLP Provision Status` = 'Multiple Provision Types'
reasoning: The query for K-8 magnet schools (Magnet=1, Low Grade='K', High Grade='8') with NSLP Provision Status = 'Multiple Provision Types' returns exactly one result: 'George Visual and Performing Arts Magnet and Middle' in Adelanto. This confirms that Adelanto is the only city with such a school, and it has exactly one.

content.text: I'll verify this claim step by step. Let me start by exploring the database schema.

input.description: List all tables in the database

content.content:
CREATE TABLE frpm
(
    CDSCode                                       TEXT not null
        primary key,
    `Academic Year`                               TEXT  null,
    `County Code`                                 TEXT  null,
    `District Code`                               INTEGER         null,
    `School Code`                                 TEXT  null,
    `County Name`                                 TEXT null,
    `District Name`                               TEXT null,
    `School Name`                                 TEXT null,
    `District Type`                               TEXT null,
    `School Type`                                 TEXT null,
    `Educational Option Type`                     TEXT null,
    `NSLP Provision Status`                       TEXT null,
    `Charter School (Y/N)`                        INTEGER    null,
    `Charter School Number`                       TEXT  null,
    `Charter Funding Type`                        TEXT null,
    IRC                                           INTEGER    null,
    `Low Grade`                                   TEXT  null,
    `High Grade`                                  TEXT null,
    `Enrollment (K-12)`                           REAL      null,
    `Free Meal Count (K-12)`                      REAL       null,
    `Percent (%) Eligible Free (K-12)`            REAL       null,
    `FRPM Count (K-12)`                           REAL       null,
    `Percent (%) Eligible FRPM (K-12)`            REAL       null,
    `Enrollment (Ages 5-17)`                      REAL       null,
    `Free Meal Count (Ages 5-17)`                 REAL       null,
    `Percent (%) Eligible Free (Ages 5-17)`       REAL       null,
    `FRPM Count (Ages 5-17)`                      REAL       null,
    `Percent (%) Eligible FRPM (Ages 5-17)`       REAL       null,
    `2013-14 CALPADS Fall 1 Certification Status` INTEGER    null,
    foreign key (CDSCode) references schools (CDSCode)
);
CREATE TABLE satscores
(
    cds         TEXT not null
        primary key,
    rtype       TEXT  not null,
    sname       TEXT null,
    dname       TEXT null,
    cname       TEXT null,
    enroll12    INTEGER         not null,
    NumTstTakr  INTEGER          not null,
    AvgScrRead  INTEGER          null,
    AvgScrMath  INTEGER          null,
    AvgScrWrite INTEGER          null,
    NumGE1500   INTEGER          null,
--     PctGE1500   double      null,
        foreign key (cds) references schools (CDSCode)
);
CREATE TABLE schools
(
    CDSCode     TEXT not null
        primary key,
    NCESDist    TEXT  null,
    NCESSchool  TEXT  null,
    StatusType  TEXT  not null,
    County      TEXT not null,
    District    TEXT not null,
    School      TEXT null,
    Street      TEXT null,
    StreetAbr   TEXT null,
    City        TEXT null,
    Zip         TEXT null,
    State       TEXT  null,
    MailStreet  TEXT null,
    MailStrAbr  TEXT null,
    MailCity    TEXT null,
    MailZip     TEXT null,
    MailState   TEXT  null,
    Phone       TEXT null,
    Ext         TEXT  null,
    Website     TEXT null,
    OpenDate    DATE        null,
    ClosedDate  DATE        null,
    Charter     INTEGER    null,
    CharterNum  TEXT  null,
    FundingType TEXT null,
    DOC         TEXT  not null,
    DOCType     TEXT not null,
    SOC         TEXT  null,
    SOCType     TEXT null,
    EdOpsCode   TEXT  null,
    EdOpsName   TEXT null,
    EILCode     TEXT  null,
    EILName     TEXT null,
    GSoffered   TEXT null,
    GSserved    TEXT  null,
    Virtual     TEXT  null,
    Magnet      INTEGER   null,
    Latitude    REAL      null,
    Longitude   REAL      null,
    AdmFName1   TEXT null,
    AdmLName1   TEXT null,
    AdmEmail1   TEXT null,
    AdmFName2   TEXT null,
    AdmLName2   TEXT null,
    AdmEmail2   TEXT null,
    AdmFName3   TEXT  null,

content.text: Good. Now let me query for K-8 magnet schools with "Multiple Provision Types" to verify the claim.

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/california_schools.sqlite" "SELECT s.City, s.School, s.Magnet, f.[NSLP Provision Status], s.GSoffered FROM schools s JOIN frpm f ON s.CDSCode = f.CDSCode WHERE s.Magnet = 1 AND f.[NSLP Provision Status] = 'Multiple Provision Types' AND f.[Low Grade] = 'K' AND f.[High Grade] = '8';"
input.description: Find K-8 magnet schools with Multiple Provision Types

content.content: Adelanto|George Visual and Performing Arts Magnet and Middle|1|Multiple Provision Types|K-8

tool_use_result.stdout: Adelanto|George Visual and Performing Arts Magnet and Middle|1|Multiple Provision Types|K-8

content.text:
The query returns exactly one result: a school in Adelanto called "George Visual and Performing Arts Magnet and Middle", which is a K-8 magnet school with "Multiple Provision Types" NSLP Provision Status.

This confirms both parts of the claim:
1. **Adelanto is the only city** with such a school — ✅ (only one city appears)
2. **It has exactly one such school** — ✅ (only one row returned)
